{"step_by_step_thinking": "Endogenous staining of teeth during development can be caused by several factors. Tetracycline, a type of antibiotic, can cause staining if taken during tooth development. Rh incompatibility and neonatal liver disease can also lead to staining due to the buildup of bilirubin. However, Vitamin-C deficiency does not cause endogenous staining of teeth. It can lead to scurvy, which affects the gums and the strength of the teeth, but it does not cause staining.", "answer_choice": "D. Vitamin-C deficiency"}
